discourse_list.title: Quarterly Strategy Review - Q1 2022 - (Public Call on Tuesday, 6/7/22, 3:00PM UTC)

content.content: All, The Q1 2022 Quarterly Strategy Review (QSR) meeting, hosted by Strategic Finance in partnership with Growth, Risk, PE, and RWF. As a reminder, the purpose of the call is to review prior quarter results, and discuss MakerDAO’s Strategic Focus Areas, Key Performance Indicators, align on priorities, and collaborate on how to overcome any challenges the DAO is facing. The intent of this call is to be a dialogue between the Core Unit hosts, Delegates, and MKR holders, and we highly encourage participation. If you would like to join the conversation, please join the below zoom from 3 - 4:30PM UTC to discuss! Zoom Dial-in @Core-Facilitators @Recognized-Delegates

Thanks everyone who was able to attend the call! As promised, here’s a copy of the presentation. We will post the video link as soon as it’s available.   docs.google.com    MakerDAO QSR - Q1 2022 - 6.7.22 Final.pptx MakerDAO QSR Quarterly Strategy Review Q1 2022 6.7.22

With regards to the SuperBear Scenario, you mention MakerDAO has approximately a 3-year runway even with ETH and WBTC vaults incurring a 90% drawdown. Assuming this scenario plays out, do your modeling also incorporate liquidations and what parameter of liquidations did you use in order to come to a conclusion that Maker does have a 2 to 3 year runway?  image1262×695 128 KB  Does the ending SB May 23 include liquidation profits based on what amount? Cc: @adcv @SebVentures

flipflopflapdelegate:  Assuming this scenario plays out, do your modeling also incorporate liquidations and what parameter of liquidations   This modeling is very top-level and we have intentionally kept liquidations low in the interest of conservatism, to essentially reduce the runway as much as we could. As balances decrease, you would expect liquidations to take over more and more share of revenue (as in the chart above). In a sudden 90% drawdown you would actually expect liquidations to be significantly higher, assuming they clear efficiently. This would add time to the operating runway at the expense of incinerating our customers, obviously not a good outcome.     flipflopflapdelegate:  Does the ending SB May 23 include liquidation profits based on what amount?   15/19.8 of the revenues in the chart above, on an annualized (monthly x12) basis are from liquidations. This is conservatively low in my view given the scenario, but prudent to manage runway planning.

Proviso / caveat: The underlying assumption is that the DAI peg prevails during a superbear scenario. If it doesn’t, and breaks substantially, the protocol’s ability to create liquid tokens for operating expenses may be compromised from one day to the next, not to mention the chaos it would cause to our holders.
Right. There’s also systemic risk and the analysis does not necessarily include such. All good, thank you for the replies.
Here’s the video for those that weren’t able to attend:
